newsitem.title: USA: GM names new head of Australian unit.
newsitem.headline: GM names new head of Australian unit.

text.p: General Motors Corp said Friday it named James Wiemels chairman and managing director of Holden Automotive, the company's Australian automotive unit.
Wiemels, 50, replaces William Hamel, 63, who is retiring after 45 years with GM. Hamel has been with GM in Australia since 1986. He was named head of Holden in 1990.

Wiemels, a GM vice president, was previously general manager of the North American Small Car Group Operations, a position he was named to in 1996, the company said. Before that, he was general manager of the Lansing Automotive Division. Wiemels takes over from Hamel March 1.

"Jim Wiemels brings to Holden a strong background in the automotive business, which will allow Holden to further its direction of expanded manufacturing and market prominence in Australia and the Asia Pacific region," Donald Sullivan, president of GM's Asian and Pacific Operations, said in a statement.
